config_description: GC Pauses greater than gc_warn_threshold_in_ms will be logged at WARN level Adjust the threshold based on your application throughput requirement. Setting to 0 will deactivate the feature.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' is used to set a threshold for garbage collection pauses. If the pause time exceeds this threshold, a log message will be generated at the WARN level. The code initializes a GCInspector object which sets up the monitoring of garbage collection.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration depends on the garbage collection activity in the system. If the garbage collection pause time exceeds the threshold set by 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms', a log message will be generated at the WARN level.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'gc_warn_threshold_in_ms' configuration option on the system is that it can help in identifying and monitoring long garbage collection pauses. This can be useful for performance tuning and identifying potential issues in the system related to garbage collection efficiency.
